reviewText: Very good, clear, simple and concise basic training on using Sony Vegas 9.  It covers most of the steps and processes to use the interface, create and import clips, stills, audio and more.  The instructor walks through, step-by-step, creating a short video with various media, fades, text overlays, and both imported and custom sound.  You get a good idea how to use the product focused on a simple short, and without going into all the levels of detail you'll need to fully master every control.  But, Joe does leave you wanting a little more, or maybe a whole lot more depth.  That said, it does the job it was designed to do.  It's a very good introduction to the Sony Vegas product, and his demonstrations and working process will get you started using it.  If Joe had a second video in the series, I wouldn't hesitate buying it and letting him instruct me on the finer details of using Sony Vegas for advanced production.

This is a great video editing software with tons of features. The only issue I have found is that there is a bit of a learning curve. I recommend you get some additional tutorials. As with all products you need to practice to get better at using all of the features and that is the case here. I highly recommend Sony Vega!Sony Vegas Movie Studio HD Platinum 11 Production Suite [Old Version]
